Functions¶

This is the only interface that you should ever need to get user info and credentials from a provider and to make asynchronous calls to protected resources of the user.

authomatic.login(provider_name, callback=None, **kwargs)¶

Launches a login procedure for specified provider and returns LoginResult.

Warning

Currently the method gets called twice by all providers. This may change in future.

  1. First it returns nothing but redirects the user to the provider, which redirects him back to the enclosing request handler.
  2. Then it gets called again and it finally returns the LoginResult or calls the function specified in the callback argument with LoginResult passed as argument.
Parameters:
  • adapter – Framework specific adapter.
  • config (dict) – Config
  • provider_name (str) – Name of the provider as specified in the keys of the Config.
  • callback (callable) – If specified the function will call the callback with LoginResult passed as argument and will return nothing.
  • report_errors (bool) – If True errors and exceptions which occur during login will be caught and accessible in the LoginResult. If False errors and exceptions will not be handled.
  • logging_level (int) – The library logs important events during the login procedure. You can specify the desired logging level with the constants of the logging of Python standard library. The main login procedure events have level INFO, others like adapter database access_with_credentials have level DEBUG.

Note

Accepts other provider specific keyword arguments.

Returns:None or LoginResult.
